gov.va.med.srcalc.vista

Interface VistaAuthenticator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VistaLinkAuthenticator

    public interface VistaAuthenticator

    Authenticates VistA credentials, providing a VistaPerson if successful.

    This is an interface to allow for easy mocking.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getDivision

        java.lang.String getDivision()
        Returns the VistA division with which this object authenticates users.

      • authenticateViaAccessVerify

        VistaPerson authenticateViaAccessVerify(java.lang.String accessCode,
                                      java.lang.String verifyCode,
                                      java.lang.String clientIp)
                                        throws javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException,
                                               javax.security.auth.login.LoginException,
                                               org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException
        Authenticates a user given an access/verify code pair.
        Parameters:
        accessCode - the user's plain-text access code
        verifyCode - the user's plain-text verify code
        clientIp - the requesting client's IP address
        Returns:
        a VistaPerson object for the user if authentication was successful
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException - if the access/verify pair was incorrect
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException - if VistA rejected the authentication for any other reason (e.g., not authorized for the division, user disabled, etc.)
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if communication with VistA failed

      • authenticateViaCcowToken

        VistaPerson authenticateViaCcowToken(java.lang.String ccowToken,
                                   java.lang.String clientIp)
                                     throws javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException,
                                            javax.security.auth.login.LoginException,
                                            org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException

        Authenticates a user given a CCOW token.

        CPRS, and presumably other VA CCOW-enabled applications, do not populate the CCOW context with the user's DUZ or any other explicit user identifier. They instead populate the context with an opaque "CCOW token" representing the specific login. (I.e., VistA assigns a new token per login.) Applications can use this method to authenticate with a CCOW token and load the user's information.

        Note that, at time of writing, VistA ties CCOW tokens to an IP address. VistA will reject the token if the passed IP does not match.

        Parameters:
        ccowToken - the CCOW token
        clientIp - the requesting client's IP address
        Returns:
        a VistaPerson object for the user if authentication was successful
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException - if VistA rejects the CCOW token
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException - if VistA rejects the login for any other reason
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if communication with VistA failed
        See Also:
        RemoteProcedure.XUS_KAAJEE_GET_USER_VIA_PROXY
